body.p: Mr Leisenring also objects to the conclusion that a purchased put or call option on a fixed number of an issuer’s equity instruments is not an asset. The rights created by these contracts meet the definition of an asset and should be accounted for as assets and not as a reduction in equity. These contracts also meet the definition of derivatives that should be accounted for as such consistently with IAS 39.
